availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oscar Turner (Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and planter)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and planter. New Orleans, Louisiana, native. Son of Fielding L. Turner. Married to Caroline E. Turner. Father of Henry Turner. Relocated with his parents to Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1826. Moved to Ballard County in 1843. Graduated from the Transylvania University Law Department in 1847. Attorney in Ballard County from 1847 to 1861. Commonwealthâ€™s attorney for the First Judicial District of Kentucky from 1851 to 1855. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in 1850 and forty-seven in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 286. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 127. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, McCuistians District, p. 181. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, McCuistians District, p. 25. Ben Perley Poore, comp., Congressional Directory Compiled for the Use of Congress (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1883), p. 31. Find A Grave, "Oscar Turner, Sr. (1825-1896)," Memorial #7095874, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=7095874&ref=acom (accessed June 22, 2017).
